message:
:(
"we have made the difficult decision to immediately stop all new development on YUI"
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: Who cares? I never used it and I never met anyone who still use it. Yahoo's wrong decisions has been killing everything good they did in the past.

A lot of websites are built on top of it... plus that PureCSS is built based on YUI
And in all cases it's sad to see a project with nice history comes to an end

It's not surprising, considering this project is almost 8 years old. In web years, this makes it ancient. Most of the problems that YUI solved no longer exist or were fixed more elegantly by competing libraries over that time period.

IMHO, I'm actually glad it went down the drain. YUI and Scriptaculous were two black dots in the web's gray history book. Scriptaculous died out 4 years ago, now it's YUI. Can't wait to see ExtJS go down as well but that's not likely to happen.

YUI has a long and storied history and the first version of ExtJS was a ripped-off copy of an earlier version of YUI. Literally just took it, renamed YUI to ExtJS and off they went. It's a matter of time till ExtJS follow the same path.
They Actually made us a good Favor :D
